page.title: 15ELECTIONS(CONT)
page.content: promised to try to improve the environment and help to create new industry. In less than a 50% turnout, which was probably due to the bad weather, Mr Armstrong polled 2037 votes, Mr Priestley 935 votes and Mr Walton polled 219 votes. Therefore, Mr Armstrong was re-elected for another four years. Countywide the results were as follows with last election's results shown in brackets. Labour won 50 seats (52); Alliance won 7 seats (8); Conservatives won 6 seats (7) and Independents and Others won 9 seats (5). This left the Labour Party very much in control of County Durham for the next four years.
